title: Add missing Internet Identity sign-in button on unauthenticated screen

requirements.text: Add a visible primary "Sign in with Internet Identity" button to the unauthenticated landing screen in `frontend/src/App.tsx` that triggers `useInternetIdentity().login()` on click, so users can initiate login.
acceptanceCriteria: When `identity` is not present, the landing screen renders a clearly visible button labeled "Sign in with Internet Identity".
Clicking the button calls the `login()` function from `useInternetIdentity` and opens the Internet Identity authentication flow.
While `loginStatus` is "logging-in", the sign-in button is disabled and shows a loading state (e.g., text changes to "Signing inâ€¦" or a spinner is shown).
If `loginStatus` is "loginError", an error message is shown on the landing screen using existing UI patterns (e.g., `ErrorState`) and the user can retry by clicking the sign-in button again.

constraints: Do not modify files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts` / `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts` or any other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Keep authentication implementation limited to wiring the existing `useInternetIdentity().login()` into the UI; do not introduce new auth providers.
No backend changes; login is purely a frontend UI fix.
nonGoals: Adding new authentication methods beyond Internet Identity.
Changing resume/coaching functionality or routing behavior.
Adding or changing static image assets as part of this fix.
